_comment: This json file contains materials. Materials are a single component, used on their own or in mixtures. They have CAS numbers and some are IFRA restricted (solvents are the exception to this rule).

materials.name: Unknown Material
materials.usage: Some proprietary mixtures don't list all of their materials (ie. Heliotropex N). In these cases, this material represents the unknown components with no IFRA restrictions.

materials.name: Perfumer's Alcohol
materials.usage: Perfumer's Alcohol (SDA 40B). Commonly used as a fixative for perfume materials.

materials.name: Dipropylene Glycol
materials.usage: Dipropylene Glycol (DPG) is practically odorless and used typically for diluting perfume materials.

materials.name: Isopropyl Myristate
materials.usage: Isopropyl Myristate is practically odorless and used typically for diluting perfume materials.

materials.name: Triplal
materials.scent: Powerful, green, just-mowed-grass odor. Has the refreshing tartness of bergamot peel.
materials.usage: Great for creating a green accord. It blends beautifully with fruity, citrus, and floral compositions.

materials.name: Zenolide
materials.scent: Soft, delicate white musk with a red fruit aspect.
materials.usage: Great for creating a clean, soft white musk note. Not extremely noticeable.

materials.name: Cinnamic Alcohol
materials.scent: Sweet, balsam, hyacinth, spicy, green, powdery, and cinnamic.
materials.usage: Cinnamon builder. Also known as Cinnamyl Alcohol.

materials.name: Methyl Isoeugenol
materials.usage: Spicy note useful for clove and spice accords and some floral accords. Also known as Methyl Eugenol.

materials.name: Heliotropin
materials.scent: Floral scent, similar to vanilla and cherry. Balsamic and powdery.
materials.usage: Heliotrope, cherry and vanilla builder. Also known as Piperonal. IFRA restriction unknown at this time.

materials.name: Anisaldehyde
materials.usage: The main component for numerous floral accords like lilac, hawthorn, anise, honeysuckle, heliotrope, etc.

materials.name: Veratric Aldehyde
materials.scent: Sweet, vanilla, creamy, heliotropee, woody, coumarin.
materials.usage: More warmth and depth than Vanillin, and excellent effect in spicy and woody-musky accords.

materials.name: Acetate C6
materials.scent: Green fruity note reminiscent of apple and pear.
materials.usage: Good blender and modifier for Labdanum. Good for sweet fruity accords. Also known as Hexyl Acetate.

materials.name: Acetate C9
materials.scent: Mild and sweet waxy ingredient that dries down to a green tropical fruity floral.
materials.usage: Adds freshness and diffusion. Also known as Nonyl Acetate.

materials.name: Acetate C12
materials.scent: A refreshing waxy, fruity odor with a citrusy, fruity, fresh, slightly floral aspect.
materials.usage: Also known as Lauryl Acetate or Dodecyl Acetate.

materials.name: Damascone Alpha
materials.scent: A sweet, fruity apple, floral wood with plum and green berry nuances.

materials.name: Damascone Beta
materials.scent: Fruity, floral, blackcurrant, plum, rose, honey, tobacco.
materials.usage: A very powerful fruity floral booster.

materials.name: Damascone Delta
materials.scent: A very complex fruity and rosy profile with tobacco, cassis, apple and plum undertones.
materials.usage: Very diffusive plum and rose builder.

materials.name: Damascone Gamma
materials.scent: Fruity, floral, rose, green, cooked apple, plum, tobacco.
materials.usage: Very diffusive plum and rose builder.
